item.title: Why Buy a Used Cell Phone?
item.description: Many people associate buying a cell phone with starting new service or upgrading their existing contract. However, there are situations where buying a new phone might not be the ideal solution. New cell phones come with a hefty price tag, either requiring a significant upfront payment or a two-year contract commitment to receive a discount or free phone from the carrier. Wanting a different phone before the contract ends usually means committing to another two years or paying the full, potentially exorbitant, price for a new one.
